Dear Mr. Genwright:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
July 22, 2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of inspection
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 599-3667.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.10209 Resident report.
A written resident report shall be completed 30 days after
admission and every 15 days thereafter for each resident in a
detention or shelter care facility. The report shall include all of
the following:
(a) The reason for continued care.
(b) Plans for other placement.
(c) Barriers to other placement and plans to eliminate the
barriers.
(d) Copies of the report shall be maintained at the facility.
Three of three resident files had written resident reports that were late. One report
was 6 days late, another report was 1 day late, and two reports had the 15-day
report period listed incorrectly.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance with all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
This is a non-contracted facility; therefore, MISEP does not apply.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional DHHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
This is a non-contracted facility.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
Technical assistance was provided regarding the itemized lists for personal
possessions for the residents at the time of his or her release. The forms were
signed by the residents but the boxes on the form were not checked indicating that
the possessions had been returned at release.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not in need of consultation.
4

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were zero incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted zero acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
A tour of the facility was conducted during the onsite renewal inspection. The facility
was observed to be clean and well maintained. Ample staff were present and
observed to be supervising the residents. Staff and residents were wearing face
masks as required due to COVID 19.
During staff interviews, staff reported both staff and residents are safe at the facility
and supervision is provided as required. Staff are given ample training opportunities
and feel supported by management. Residents indicated the rules of the facility are
clear. Residents reported feeling safe at the facility.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
